title: Energy and pd - particle moved from P to X Y or Z

content.question: A region of space has a uniform electric field <math alttext="vector E" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mover><mi>E</mi><mo>â†’</mo></mover></math> directed toward the right, as shown in the figure. A positively-charged particle (not shown) is initially located at Point <math alttext="P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">P</mi></math>. The particle can be moved by an external force from Point <math alttext="P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">P</mi></math> to points <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></math>, <math alttext="Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Y</mi></math>, or <math alttext="Z" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Z</mi></math>, which are all located the same distance <math alttext="d" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>d</mi></math> from Point <math alttext="P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">P</mi></math> and are all located within the uniform electric field. Which of the following correctly compares the electric potential energies <math alttext="U sub X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>U</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></msub></math>, <math alttext="U sub Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>U</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">Y</mi></msub></math>, and <math alttext="U sub Z" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>U</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">Z</mi></msub></math> of the particle-field system when the particle is moved to points <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></math>, <math alttext="Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Y</mi></math>, or <math alttext="Z" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Z</mi></math>, respectively?

choices.label: <math alttext="U sub X equals U sub Y, which equals U sub Z" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>U</mi><mtext>X</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>U</mi><mtext>Y</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>U</mi><mtext>Z</mtext></msub></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="U sub X is greater than U sub Y, which is greater than U sub Z" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>U</mi><mtext>X</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>U</mi><mtext>Y</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>U</mi><mtext>Z</mtext></msub></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="U sub X equals U sub Z, which is greater than U sub Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>U</mi><mtext>X</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>U</mi><mtext>Z</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>U</mi><mtext>Y</mtext></msub></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="U sub X is greater than U sub Z, which is greater than U sub Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>U</mi><mtext>X</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>U</mi><mtext>Z</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>U</mi><mtext>Y</mtext></msub></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="U sub X is greater than U sub Y, which is greater than U sub Z" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>U</mi><mtext>X</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>U</mi><mtext>Y</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>U</mi><mtext>Z</mtext></msub></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
